dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: What to look out for from Mag 7 earnings, including Nvidia and Tesla
News Content: The latest earnings season has gotten off to a strong start, with investor attention turning to the "Magnificent 7" tech giants to see if their results can add to this momentum.

The major tech stocks led market gains in 2024 and the question for investors now is whether they can continue to do so in 2025.

More specifically, the Magnificent 7 — Tesla, Meta, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet and Nvidia — were responsible for more than half of the S&P 500’s (^GSPC) 25% return in 2024.

Tech stocks were already poised to climb higher this year, with Donald Trump's return to the White House, given his pledges to loosen regulations and cut taxes, as well as to invest heavily in AI.

Billionaire tech CEOs have also been flocking to forge closer ties with Trump, with many in attendance at his inauguration.

Read more: Best fund picks for investing in a Trump 2.0 presidency

In the first few days of Trump's second presidential term tech stocks rallied, after he unveiled a $500bn (£405bn) private-sector investment plan — known as the "Stargate" project — to build AI infrastructure in the US.

In a note on Wednesday, John Higgins, chief markets economist at Capital Economics, said: "Trump’s ringing endorsement of Stargate is another shot in the arm for AI in the early days of his second presidency, and supports our long-standing view that the S&P 500 will thrive in 2025 amid growing investment in, and enthusiasm for, this transformative technology."

Given this theme is set to continue to dominate markets this year, investors will be watching to see which of the Mag 7 stocks are leading the way on the AI trend, or if any are falling behind.

Here's what experts expect to see from the Mag 7 this earnings season.

Tesla (TSLA) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

Shares in electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla have surged since Trump's election victory in November, with the stock becoming known as part of the "Trump trade", as CEO Elon Musk has become a close ally of the president.

Musk, who was a major supporter of Trump campaign, was appointed to lead the new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

The rally in Tesla shares comes despite the company reporting an annual delivery decline in early January for the first time in more than a decade. Tesla delivered 1.78 million vehicles in 2024, which was below analyst estimates of 1.8 million.

Tesla shares fell following the release of these figures and while Musk's expected role of influence on the incoming Trump administration saw the stock rise ahead of the inauguration, it fell back on the first full day of trading after the Republican president returned to office.

Story Continues

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

This came after Trump revoked a policy that mandated half of the new US cars manufactured be electric by 2030 and directed his administration to consider eliminating "unfair subsidies" on EVs.

Musk had said last year that he didn't think Tesla would be as impacted as competitors by the scrapping of subsidies and believed it could even help the company in the long term.

Despite these headwinds, analysts remain confident about the stock. Piper Sandler analyst Alexander Potter said he believed that Tesla would shift away from launching new EVs and focus on "popularising" its autonomous driving software, changing his price target on the stock to $500 from $315.

In terms of financial performance, Tesla posted third quarter revenue of $25.18bn, which was below estimates of $25.4bn. However, adjusted earnings per share of $0.72 came in ahead of an anticipated $0.60, and Tesla's closely-watched gross margin figure came in at 19.8%, much higher than the 16.8% expected.

As for Tesla outlook, the company said in its quarterly earnings deck that plans for new vehicles, including more affordable models, "remain on track for start of production in the first half of 2025".

•USD

(TSLA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Meta (META) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Facebook-owner Meta, is another tech leader that has been trying to build a closer relationship with Trump.

Meta committed $1m to Trump's inaugural fund and recently announced it had appointed Ultimate Fighting Championship CEO Dana White, an ally of Trump, as one of three new board members.

Zuckerberg also recently announced an end to the company's third-party fact-checking programme in the US, a move that was considered as part of a repositioning ahead of Trump's return to office.

Meta shares are up 62% over the past year, though the stock fell following the release of its third quarter earnings in October.

The company delivered earnings per share of $6.03, which bested estimates of $5.25 and revenue of $40.5bn beat forecasts of $40.2bn.

Read more: 6 crypto developments in 2025 that will keep fuelling bitcoin's rally

However, expectations were high going into this set of results and Meta guided to fourth quarter revenue guidance of between $45bn and $48bn for the quarter, compared to analyst forecasts of $46.09bn. The company also said it expects capital expenses to grow significantly in 2025.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown, said: "Meta has set itself apart among tech giants by turning AI investments into quick wins. Unlike cloud providers that sell AI capabilities, Meta focuses its efforts on enhancing its own products, driving higher ad revenue."

"That’s not to say the AI push comes cheap," he added. "Zuckerberg sees AI as a once-in-a-generation opportunity, and the spending reflects that ambition. Investment will be watched closely, with some $15bn needed to be spent over the quarter to achieve full-year spending plans.

"Investors, understandably cautious after Meta’s past overspending on projects like the metaverse, will be laser-focused on investment plans for 2025."

•USD

(META)

Follow  View Quote Details

Microsoft (MSFT) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

As the Stargate project was unveiled, Microsoft said it signed a new agreement with OpenAI, which included "changes to the exclusivity on new capacity".

Microsoft has been OpenAI's biggest backer and has provided data centre infrastructure for the ChatGPT maker to run its language models.

While this new agreement marks a shift in the arrangement between the two companies, Microsoft was still named as one of the key initial technology partners on Stargate.

The company also recently said it planned to spend $80bn on AI in this fiscal year. Microsoft has also been among the tech companies to jump into the trend of digital agents powered by AI.

In October, Microsoft announced the rollout of its Copilot features, which aim to enhance business productivity by automating routine administrative tasks.

Futurum Group CEO Daniel Newman told Yahoo Finance in December that he projected AI agents represent a $4tn annual global market opportunity over the next five years, describing it as "a massive opportunity" for companies.

Read more: FTSE housing stocks set to benefit from property market rebound

In terms of broader company performance, Microsoft's fiscal first quarter results beat expectations. The company reported earnings per share of $3.30, versus forecasts of $3.10 and revenue of $65.6bn also topped expectations of $64.5bn.

However, market reaction was downbeat, given mixed guidance on the earnings call. There were concerns around pressure on company profit margins in second quarter given the ramp up in AI spending.

Shares have had a bumpy ride over the past year, capping gains at nearly 12%.

Britzman said that the key metric to watch in the second quarter results was growth in its cloud computing Azure business, which is expected to come in at 31% to 32%.

"Microsoft has said more recently that its capacity constraints are resolved, so markets hope to get a better picture of current demand levels in the coming quarters," he said. "Beyond Azure, the rollout of Copilot will also be under scrutiny, with investors eager to see how product development and adoption are progressing after some criticism from peers."

•USD

(MSFT)

Follow  View Quote Details

Apple (AAPL) — reports on Thursday 30 January

Shares in Apple have come under pressure recently, amid disappointing news around its iPhone market share.

Apple's stock has suffered two analyst rating downgrades this week alone. Jefferies (JEF) analyst Edison Lee lowered the investment bank's rating on Apple shares to "underperform" and decreased his price target on the stock by 13% to $200.75.

Lee said in an investor note that he expected Apple's first quarter results — which are due out next week — to come in below expectations, and for the company to miss against estimates for the second quarter on weak iPhone sales and a lack of interest in AI among consumers.

Meanwhile, Loop Capital downgraded Apple from "buy" to "hold" and lowered its price target on the stock from $275 to $230.

Meanwhile, Counterpoint Research found sales of Apple's iPhones fell 18.2% in China in the December quarter, according to a Bloomberg report. The research also showed that the iPhone gave up its title of the top selling smartphone handsets in China to Huawei Technologies.

Read more: Funds for investors to watch in 2025

And data from from market analyst firm Canalys showed that Apple lost its top spot as the smartphone maker with the biggest market share in mainland China.

The recent fall in the Apple's shares, has seen the company's market valuation down decline to $3.41tn, and chipmaker Nvidia overtake it once again as the world's most valuable company, with a market capitalisation of $3.55tn.

In the fourth quarter, Apple reported earnings per share of $0.97 on revenue on revenue of $94.9bn. The company said it saw a one-time charge related to the reversal of a European General Court decision that requires Apple to pay €13bn to Ireland for back taxes.

Without the charge, EPS would have come in at $1.64. That would have blown past expectations of $1.59 per share and revenue of $94.3bn.

•USD

(AAPL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Amazon (AMZN) — reports on Thursday 30 January

A major focus for Amazon's fourth quarter results next week will be its cloud business, Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Revenue for this part of the business came in at $27.5bn in the third quarter, which was in line with Wall Street expectations, but was still up 19% year-on-year.

Shares popped following the release of Amazon's third quarter results, as it posted earnings per share of $1.43, which was ahead of estimates of $1.16. Revenue of $158.9bn also beat expectations of $157.29bn.

Investors also cheered Amazon's guidance for the fourth quarter, with the company expecting net sales to come in at between $181.5bn and $188.5bn.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

Amazon is expecting to report operating income of between $16bn and $20bn, against the $13.2bn it reported for the same period in 2023.

Hargreaves Lansdown's Briztman said: "As usual, AWS will be the cloud hanging over market sentiment — any growth materially above 19% should get a warm reception. Investors will also be tuned in for updates on AWS’s AI initiatives and the eye-popping investment Amazon plans to spend in the space."

"Meanwhile, let’s not forget Amazon’s trusty old e-commerce arm, often overshadowed by its cloud cousin," he added. "For the first time in a while, it’s showing signs of life, with fresh initiatives like the discount storefront ‘Amazon Haul’ helping expand its reach. If Amazon can fine-tune automation, there’s potential for some tasty margin expansion too."

•USD

(AMZN)

Follow  View Quote Details

Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) — reports on Tuesday 4 February

Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google-owner Alphabet, was another tech leader in attendance at Trump's inauguration.

A day later, Business Insider reported that Alphabet's chief investment officer Ruth Porat said at the World Economic Forum in Davos that there's a "tremendous amount of opportunity" to work with Trump in his second term.

These comments come after Alphabet has been grappling with regulatory headwinds over the past year. In November, the US Department of Justice (DOJ) asked that Google be forced to sell off its Chrome browser, as part of proposed remedies aimed at ending the company's dominance in internet search.

This filing came after a judge ruled in favour of prosecutors in a landmark trial in August, who argued that that Google ran its search engine empire as an illegal monopoly. The judge will will now decide what should happen next in a separate "remedies" phase of the trial that is expected to start this year.

Read more: Stocks to watch in European luxury and retail in 2025, according to Deutsche Bank

When Trump was asked in an interview in October about whether he believed Google should be broken up, he said: "Google’s got a lot of power. They’re very bad to me."

While Trump didn't go into specifics when asked if he would break up the business, he said: "I’d do something."

Despite regulatory concerns, Alphabet has continued to show strong performance, with the company smashing estimates in its third quarter results. Alphabet posted earnings per share of $2.12, compared to expectations of $1.83 and revenue of $88.27bn came in well ahead of estimates of $86.44bn.

Looking ahead to the fourth quarter, Britzman said that having "arrived fashionably late to the AI party, Alphabet is now making a splash. AI-powered overviews in Google search are starting to show their value, and investors will be laser-focused on ad revenue, still the core growth driver with a 9.5% uplift expected from [the] fourth-quarter results."

•USD

(GOOGL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Nvidia (NVDA) — reports on Wednesday 26 February

Market darling Nvidia will be the last of the Mag 7 to report, with investors eagerly anticipating the earnings for signals on the strength of AI chip demand.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang was one of the few tech execs not to attend Trump's inauguration, though the company was another named as a key initial technology partners on the Stargate project.

Shares in Nvidia are up a whopping 145% over the past year, though increasingly high expectations mean markets have become highly sensitive to any disappointing news around the chipmaker.

Read more: Surprising UK pay growth could delay Bank of England’s interest rate cuts

The stock dipped following the release of its third quarter results, even though Nvidia beat estimates on key metrics. Revenue of $35.1bn was comfortably ahead of analysts estimates of $33.2bn and earnings per share came in at $0.81 beat expectations of $0.74.

However, gross margins were lower quarter-on-quarter from 75.1% to 74.6%.

In addition, Nvidia guided to revenue of $37.5bn for the fourth quarter, plus or minus 2%, which would be just ahead of Wall Street expectations of $37bn.

Even so, analysts remain bullish on Nvidia, with Barclays (BARC.L) keeping an "overweight" rating on the stock and raising its price target on the stock from $160 to $175.

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The reassignment of Kim Vorrath to the AI and Machine Learning Division suggests that Apple is prioritizing advancements in these critical areas, which could enhance its competitive edge and innovation. This move may be perceived positively by investors, as it indicates a commitment to integrating AI into Apple's product ecosystem. However, the impact on stock price may be tempered by broader market conditions and investor sentiment. Overall, the news is likely to be viewed favorably, leading to a higher probability of stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed outlook for Apple (AAPL). While the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts), Apple specifically faces headwinds. Analyst downgrades, declining iPhone market share in China, and a perceived lack of AI innovation are significant concerns. The article highlights that Apple's stock has already been under pressure. While past earnings reports have shown some positive surprises, the current negative sentiment and specific challenges outweigh the general market optimism. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article discusses allegations of price discrimination by ride-hailing companies Ola and Uber in India, based on the user's phone operating system (Android vs. iOS).  Apple is mentioned only indirectly as some users reported higher fares when using iPhones.  Ola's denial of using phone model-based pricing is irrelevant to Apple's stock price. The news does not contain any information directly impacting Apple's financials, products, or operations. Therefore, the impact on Apple's stock price is expected to be negligible.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline discusses President Trump's initiative to roll back DEI programs, which has sparked corporate resistance, including from companies like Apple. While the political climate may create uncertainty, Apple's firm stance on DEI values aligns with broader corporate trends and shareholder sentiments, as seen with Costco's recent vote. This could be viewed positively by investors who value corporate social responsibility. However, the potential for regulatory changes and political backlash introduces some risk. Overall, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely neutral to slightly positive, given its strong brand and market position.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article reports that Apple has reassigned executive Kim Vorrath to its AI and Machine Learning division. Vorrath is known for managing complex products, which suggests that Apple is strengthening its capabilities in AI and Machine Learning by moving a veteran executive to lead or support these efforts. This move is generally perceived as positive, as it indicates Apple's continued investment in emerging technologies that are likely to drive future growth. However, the impact on the stock price may be limited as the move is more strategic and less of a direct financial performance indicator. Therefore, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising and a low probability of it falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news article does not directly relate to Apple Inc.'s financial performance or business operations. It discusses allegations of differential pricing by ride-hailing firms Ola and Uber based on phone models, with no direct implication on Apple's stock price. The article does mention Apple phones in the context of the allegations, but there is no indication that Apple is involved in or responsible for the pricing practices of Ola or Uber. Therefore, the news is unlikely to have a significant impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple's strong financial performance, including beating Wall Street expectations and positive developments in integrating AI into their products. The company is also ranked first among stocks predicted by ChatGPT to be wealth-generating over the next 10 years. While there are concerns about potential tariffs and geopolitical tensions, the overall outlook remains positive with a bullish consensus from Wall Street analysts.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The reassignment of Kim Vorrath to the AI and Machine Learning Division suggests that Apple is focusing on enhancing its capabilities in these critical areas, which could be viewed positively by investors. This move indicates a commitment to innovation and staying competitive in the tech landscape. While there are broader market concerns and some negative sentiment surrounding Apple, the specific news about Vorrath's reassignment is likely to be interpreted as a strategic positive. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the 'Magnificent 7' are generally expected to perform well, Apple specifically faces challenges. Analyst downgrades due to weak iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI innovation are significant concerns. The article highlights a decline in iPhone market share in China. However, Apple's past earnings reports have shown positive surprises. Considering the negative sentiment and specific challenges, but also the potential for Apple to outperform expectations, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling than rising. The previous round of predictions were mixed, with some models predicting a rise and others a fall, indicating uncertainty.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.49, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.51, Reasoning: The news article focuses on allegations of price discrimination by ride-hailing services Ola and Uber in India, based on the user's phone operating system.  Apple is only indirectly mentioned as some users reported higher fares on iPhones.  Ola's denial of using phone model-based pricing is irrelevant to Apple's stock performance. The news lacks any direct impact on Apple's financials, products, or operations.  Therefore, the probability of a stock price movement due to this news is extremely low.  Considering the previous predictions, which range widely and are based on various other factors unrelated to this specific news, I'm assigning a near-neutral probability, slightly leaning towards no change, reflecting the insignificance of this news to Apple's stock price.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news discusses President Trump's initiative to roll back DEI programs, which has sparked corporate resistance, including from companies like Apple. Apple's firm stance on DEI values aligns with broader corporate trends and shareholder sentiments, as seen with Costco's recent vote. This could be viewed positively by investors who value corporate social responsibility. However, the potential for regulatory changes and political backlash introduces some risk. The previous predictions show a mix of opinions, with some models leaning slightly positive due to Apple's strong brand and market position, while others are more neutral or negative due to broader market concerns. Overall, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely neutral to slightly positive, given its strong brand and market position.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple has moved veteran executive Kim Vorrath to its AI and Machine Learning division. This strategic move suggests that Apple is prioritizing advancements in AI and Machine Learning, which are critical areas for future growth and innovation. The reassignment of a veteran executive known for managing complex products to this division is likely to be perceived positively by investors, as it indicates a commitment to enhancing Apple's competitive edge in these technologies. While the broader market conditions and investor sentiment may influence the stock price, the specific news about Vorrath's reassignment is generally favorable. Therefore, the probability of the stock price rising is estimated to be higher than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news article discusses allegations of differential pricing by ride-hailing firms Ola and Uber in India, based on the user's phone operating system (Android vs. iOS). Apple is mentioned only indirectly as some users reported higher fares when using iPhones. However, both Ola and Uber have denied implementing phone model-based pricing, which suggests that the issue may not be directly related to Apple's business practices or financial performance. Considering the indirect impact and lack of direct involvement of Apple in the pricing practices of Ola and Uber, the news is unlikely to have a significant impact on Apple's stock price. The previous predictions from other models show a wide range of opinions, but most of them agree that the news has little to no direct impact on Apple's stock price. Therefore, I estimate a low probability of the stock price rising or falling due to this news.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's strong financial performance, including beating Wall Street expectations and positive developments in integrating AI into their products. The company is also ranked first among stocks predicted by ChatGPT to be wealth-generating over the next 10 years. While there are concerns about potential tariffs and geopolitical tensions, the overall outlook remains positive with a bullish consensus from Wall Street analysts. The general market sentiment is also positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency, including AI investments, deregulation, and tax cuts.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The reassignment of Kim Vorrath to Apple's AI and Machine Learning Division suggests a strategic focus on enhancing capabilities in these critical areas, which is likely to be viewed positively by investors. This move indicates a commitment to innovation and staying competitive in the tech landscape. While there are broader market concerns and some negative sentiment surrounding Apple, the specific news about Vorrath's reassignment is likely to be interpreted as a strategic positive. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. Several analysts have downgraded the stock due to disappointing iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI innovation. The article also highlights a decline in iPhone market share in China. These are significant negative factors. However, Apple has a history of positive earnings surprises, and the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts). Considering the specific negative news about Apple, the analyst downgrades, and the market share decline, but also the potential for Apple to outperform expectations and the positive broader market sentiment, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price falling than rising. The previous rounds of predictions were mixed, with a slight trend towards a more negative outlook in the most recent round.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.49, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.51, Reasoning: The news about Ola and Uber's pricing practices in India is largely irrelevant to Apple's stock price.  While Apple iPhones are mentioned in the context of user complaints, the news focuses on the ride-hailing companies' denials of discriminatory pricing. There's no direct link to Apple's financials, products, or operations.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, mostly due to other factors affecting Apple's stock.  Considering the lack of direct impact from this specific news, and the overall mixed sentiment from previous predictions based on other news, I'm assigning a near-neutral probability, slightly favoring no change in Apple's stock price.  The slight lean towards no change reflects the insignificance of this news compared to other factors influencing Apple's stock performance.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline discusses President Trump's initiative to roll back DEI programs and the corporate resistance it has sparked, including from Apple. Apple's stance on maintaining DEI values aligns with broader corporate trends and shareholder sentiments, as evidenced by Costco's recent vote. This could be viewed positively by investors who prioritize corporate social responsibility, potentially boosting Apple's stock price. However, the political uncertainty and potential regulatory changes introduce some risk. Previous predictions from various models show a mix of opinions, ranging from positive to neutral or slightly negative, but the majority lean towards a neutral to slightly positive impact due to Apple's strong brand and market position. Considering Apple's firm stance on DEI and the overall positive corporate resistance trend, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly higher than a fall.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's reassignment of veteran executive Kim Vorrath to its AI and Machine Learning division. This move indicates Apple's focus on enhancing its capabilities in AI and Machine Learning, which are critical areas for future growth and innovation. The reassignment suggests a commitment to integrating AI into Apple's product ecosystem, which could enhance its competitive edge. However, the impact on the stock price may be tempered by broader market conditions and investor sentiment. Given the positive strategic implications of this move, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news article discusses allegations of differential pricing by ride-hailing firms Ola and Uber in India, based on the user's phone operating system (Android vs. iOS). Apple is mentioned only indirectly as some users reported higher fares when using iPhones. However, both Ola and Uber have denied implementing phone model-based pricing, which suggests that the issue may not be directly related to Apple's business practices or financial performance. Considering the indirect impact and lack of direct involvement of Apple in the pricing practices of Ola and Uber, the news is unlikely to have a significant impact on Apple's stock price. The previous predictions from other models show a wide range of opinions, but most of them agree that the news has little to no direct impact on Apple's stock price. Therefore, I estimate a low probability of the stock price rising or falling due to this news.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's strong financial performance, including beating Wall Street expectations and positive developments in integrating AI into their products. The company is also ranked first among stocks predicted by ChatGPT to be wealth-generating over the next 10 years. While there are concerns about potential tariffs and geopolitical tensions, the overall outlook remains positive with a bullish consensus from Wall Street analysts. The general market sentiment is also positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency, including AI investments, deregulation, and tax cuts.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news presents a mixed but largely negative outlook for Apple. While the 'Magnificent 7' are generally expected to perform well, Apple specifically faces challenges. Several analysts have downgraded the stock due to disappointing iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI innovation. The article also highlights a decline in iPhone market share in China, which is a significant negative factor. The company's market valuation has declined, and Nvidia has overtaken it as the world's most valuable company. While Apple has a history of positive earnings surprises, the specific negative news about Apple, the analyst downgrades, and the market share decline outweigh the potential for positive surprises. The previous rounds of predictions were mixed, with a trend towards a more negative outlook in the most recent round. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price falling than rising.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "What to look out for from Mag 7 earnings, including Nvidia and Tesla",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.3,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.7
}
```
